alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North Cass; North Itasca; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; South Cass; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 10:15AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...North St. Louis, Northern Cook and Lake, North Itasca, Central St. Louis, North Cass, South Itasca and South Cass Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Bois Forte Band, Lake Vermilion, Nett Lake and, Deer Creek areas. * WHEN...Until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow loading on trees from the past storm in combination with the high winds may cause tree damage resulting in power outages in cold weather. Brief periods of whiteout conditions may be possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North Cass; North Itasca; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; South Cass; South Itasca
